definition: to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

sentences.english: So you future relationships must be farther to the.
sentences.chinese: 这样你们今后的关系肯定会越走越顺当的。

sentences.english: The only time you're likely to be happy is when everything is working out just right.
sentences.chinese: 你惟一的快乐时光便是一切都顺顺当当尽如人意。

sentences.english: However, there came a day finally when the sword slipped into the scabbard quite easily.
sentences.chinese: 然而这一天终于来到了，剑顺顺当当地插入了鞘。

sentences.english: The better the day, the better the deed.
sentences.chinese: 日子越美好，事业越顺当。

sentences.english: We made excellent time and arrived in Spain in two days.
sentences.chinese: 我们一路很顺当，两天后就到了西班牙。

sentences.english: You can't expect people to give you all the answers on a plate.
sentences.chinese: 你不能指望人家把所有的答案都顺顺当当地奉送给你。

sentences.english: My work always goes badly when I'm tired.
sentences.chinese: 我疲倦时工作总是不顺当。

sentences.english: He adjusted himself very quickly to the business environment of the country.
sentences.chinese: 他使本人很快顺当了那个国家的商业环境。

sentences.english: Our work is just bumming along.
Did you get on it a bit?

definition: everything is going smoothly/just as one wishes
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
to go wrong/to take a wrong turning
everything steady and stable (idiom); overcautious and unimaginary
tight (i.e. lacking money)/hard up/same as 緊巴巴|紧巴巴
